summary: This is a brief email exchange between an FBI agent and a U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) prosecutor regarding a conference call about Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutor indicates the call went well overall but mentions a 'new development' and promises to call back soon.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The email exchange is about a conference call concerning him, referred to as 'Epstein'.

events.title: Conference Call on Epstein Case
events.description: A conference call was held regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The prosecutor reported it 'went well' but mentioned a 'new development'.

keyFacts: An email exchange on June 13, 2008, discusses a conference call about Jeffrey Epstein.
The prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office states the call 'went well overall'.
The prosecutor mentions there is a 'new development' in the case but does not specify details in the email.
The communication shows ongoing coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein investigation in mid-2008.
